member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource
member.summary: AVI file video source.

remarks.para: The video source reads AVI files using Video for Windows.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Video file name.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.Start
member.summary: Start video source.
member.remarks: Starts video source and return execution to caller. Video source object creates background thread and notifies about new frames with the help of event.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signal video source to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals video source to stop its background thread, stop to provide new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for video source has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for source stopping after it was signalled to stop using method.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.Stop
member.summary: Stop video source.

remarks.para: Stops video source aborting its thread.

para.note: Since the method aborts background thread, its usage is highly not preferred and should be done only if there are no other options. The correct way of stopping camera is signaling it stop and then waiting for background thread's completion.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.Free
member.summary: Free resource.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.WorkerThread
member.summary: Worker thread.

member.name: E:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from video source.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: E:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.PlayingFinished
member.summary: Video playing finished event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.FrameInterval
member.summary: Frame interval.

remarks.para: The property sets the interval in milliseconds between frames. If the property is set to 100, then the desired frame rate will be 10 frames per second.

para.note: Setting this property to 0 leads to no delay between video frames - frames are read as fast as possible.

remarks.para: Default value is set to 0.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.FrameIntervalFromSource
member.summary: Get frame interval from source or use manually specified.

remarks.para: The property specifies which frame rate to use for video playing. If the property is set to , then video is played with original frame rate, which is set in source AVI file. If the property is set to , then custom frame rate is used, which is calculated based on the manually specified frame interval.
Default value is set to .

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.Source
member.summary: Video source.

remarks.para: Video file name to play.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.FramesReceived
member.summary: Received frames count.
member.remarks: Number of frames the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.BytesReceived
member.summary: Received bytes count.
member.remarks: Number of bytes the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.IsRunning
member.summary: State of the video source.
member.remarks: Current state of video source object - running or not.

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader
member.summary: AVI files reading using Video for Windows.

remarks.para: The class allows to read AVI files using Video for Windows API.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Finalize
member.summary: Destroys the instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the object.
member.remarks: Frees unmanaged resources used by the object. The object becomes unusable after that.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the object.
member.param: Indicates if disposing was initiated manually.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Open(System.String)
member.summary: Open AVI file.
member.param: AVI file name to open.

remarks.para: The method opens a video file and prepares the stream and decoder for reading video frames with the help of method.

member.exception: A error occurred while opening the video file. See exception message.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Close
member.summary: Close video file.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.GetNextFrame
member.summary: Get next frame of opened video stream.
member.returns: Returns next frame as a bitmap.

remarks.para: The method reads and returns the next video frame in the opened video stream at the position, which is set in property.

member.exception: Thrown if no video file was open.
A error occurred while reading next video frame. See exception message.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Width
member.summary: Width of video frames.

remarks.para: The property specifies the width of video frames within the opened video file.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Height
member.summary: Height of video frames.

remarks.para: The property specifies the height of video frames within the opened video file.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Position
member.summary: Current position in video stream.
member.remarks: Setting position outside of video range, will lead to reseting position to the start.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Start
member.summary: Starting position of video stream.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Length
member.summary: Video stream length.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.FrameRate
member.summary: Desired playing frame rate.

remarks.para: The property specifies the frame rate, which should be used to play the opened video file.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIReader.Codec
member.summary: Codec used for video compression.

remarks.para: The property tells about which codec was used to encode the opened video file.

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter
member.summary: AVI files writing using Video for Windows interface.

remarks.para: The class allows to write AVI files using Video for Windows API.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Codec to use for compression.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Finalize
member.summary: Destroys the instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the object.
member.remarks: Frees unmanaged resources used by the object. The object becomes unusable after that.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the object.
member.param: Indicates if disposing was initiated manually.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Open(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create new AVI file and open it for writing.
member.param: AVI file name to create.
Video width.
Video height.

remarks.para: The method opens (creates) a video files, configure video codec and prepares the stream for saving video frames with a help of method.

member.exception: A error occurred while creating new video file. See exception message.
Video file resolution must be a multiple of two.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Close
member.summary: Close video file.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.AddFrame(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Add new frame to the AVI file.
member.param: New frame image.

remarks.para: The method adds new video frame to an opened video file. The width and heights of the frame should be the same as it was specified in method (see and properties).

member.exception: Thrown if no video file was open.
Bitmap size must be of the same as video size, which was specified on opening video file.
A error occurred while writing new video frame. See exception message.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Width
member.summary: Width of video frames.

remarks.para: The property specifies the width of video frames, which are acceptable by method for saving, which is set in method.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Height
member.summary: Height of video frames.

remarks.para: The property specifies the height of video frames, which are acceptable by method for saving, which is set in method.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Position
member.summary: Current position in video stream.

remarks.para: The property tell current position in video stream, which actually equals to the amount of frames added using method.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.FrameRate
member.summary: Desired playing frame rate.

remarks.para: The property sets the video frame rate, which should be use during playing of the video to be saved.

para.note: The property should be set befor opening new file to take effect.

remarks.para: Default frame rate is set to 25.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Codec
member.summary: Codec used for video compression.

remarks.para: The property sets the FOURCC code of video compression codec, which needs to be used for video encoding.

para.note: The property should be set befor opening new file to take effect.

remarks.para: Default video codec is set "DIB ", which means no compression.

member.name: P:AForge.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Quality
member.summary: Compression video quality.

remarks.para: The property sets video quality used by codec in order to balance compression rate and image quality. The quality is measured usually in the [0, 100] range.

para.note: The property should be set befor opening new file to take effect.

remarks.para: Default value is set to -1 - default compression quality of the codec.

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32
member.summary: Windows API functions and structures.
member.remarks: The class provides Video for Windows and some other Win32 functions and structurs.

Stream interface.

Stream interface.

member.summary: Release an open AVI stream.

member.returns: Returns the current reference count of the stream.

Position in the stream to receive the format.

Size, in bytes, of the block of memory referenced by format.

member.summary: Get the starting sample number for the stream.

member.returns: Returns the number if successful or – 1 otherwise.

member.summary: Get the length of the stream.

member.returns: Returns the stream's length, in samples, if successful or -1 otherwise.

member.summary: Obtain stream header information.

Pointer to a structure to contain the stream information.
Size, in bytes, of the structure used for streamInfo.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVIStreamGetFrameOpen(System.IntPtr,AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER@)
member.summary: Prepare to decompress video frames from the specified video stream
member.param: Pointer to the video stream used as the video source.
Pointer to a structure that defines the desired video format. Specify NULL to use a default format.
member.returns: Returns an object that can be used with the function.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVIStreamGetFrameOpen(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Prepare to decompress video frames from the specified video stream.
member.param: Pointer to the video stream used as the video source.
Pointer to a structure that defines the desired video format. Specify NULL to use a default format.
member.returns: Returns a GetFrame object that can be used with the function.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVIStreamGetFrameClose(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Releases resources used to decompress video frames.
member.param: Handle returned from the function.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVIStreamGetFrame(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the address of a decompressed video frame.
member.param: Pointer to a GetFrame object.
Position, in samples, within the stream of the desired frame.
member.returns: Returns a pointer to the frame data if successful or NULL otherwise.

member.name: M:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVIStreamWrite(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Write data to a stream.
member.param: Handle to an open stream.
First sample to write.
Number of samples to write.
Pointer to a buffer containing the data to write.
Size of the buffer referenced by buffer.
Flag associated with this data.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the number of samples written. This can be set to NULL.
Pointer to a buffer that receives the number of bytes written. This can be set to NULL.
member.returns: Returns zero if successful or an error otherwise.

member.summary: Retrieve the save options for a file and returns them in a buffer.
member.param: Handle to the parent window for the Compression Options dialog box.
Flags for displaying the Compression Options dialog box.
Number of streams that have their options set by the dialog box.
Pointer to an array of stream interface pointers.
Pointer to an array of pointers to AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structures.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if the user pressed OK, FALSE for CANCEL, or an error otherwise.

member.summary: Free the resources allocated by the AVISaveOptions function.

Pointer to an array of pointers to AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS structures.
member.returns: Returns 0.

member.summary: Create a compressed stream from an uncompressed stream and a compression filter, and returns the address of a pointer to the compressed stream.

Pointer to the stream to be compressed.
Pointer to a structure that identifies the type of compression to use and the options to apply.
Pointer to a class identifier used to create the stream.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.RECT.bottom

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO
member.summary: Structure, which contains information for a single stream .

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.type
member.summary: Four-character code indicating the stream type.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.handler
member.summary: Four-character code of the compressor handler that will compress this video stream when it is saved.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.flags
member.summary: Applicable flags for the stream.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.Capabilities
member.summary: Capability flags; currently unused.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.priority
member.summary: Priority of the stream.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.language
member.summary: Language of the stream.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.scale
member.summary: Time scale applicable for the stream.
member.remarks: Dividing rate by scale gives the playback rate in number of samples per second.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.rate
member.summary: Rate in an integer format.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.start
member.summary: Sample number of the first frame of the AVI file.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.length
member.summary: Length of this stream.
member.remarks: The units are defined by rate and scale.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.initialFrames
member.summary: Audio skew. This member specifies how much to skew the audio data ahead of the video frames in interleaved files.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.suggestedBufferSize
member.summary: Recommended buffer size, in bytes, for the stream.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.quality
member.summary: Quality indicator of the video data in the stream.
member.remarks: Quality is represented as a number between 0 and 10,000.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.sampleSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of a single data sample.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.rectFrame
member.summary: Dimensions of the video destination rectangle.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.editCount
member.summary: Number of times the stream has been edited.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.formatChangeCount
member.summary: Number of times the stream format has changed.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVISTREAMINFO.name
member.summary: Description of the stream.

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER
member.summary: Structure, which contains information about the dimensions and color format of a DIB.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.size
member.summary: Specifies the number of bytes required by the structure.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.height
member.summary: Specifies the height of the bitmap, in pixels.
member.remarks: If height is positive, the bitmap is a bottom-up DIB and its origin is the lower-left corner. If height is negative, the bitmap is a top-down DIB and its origin is the upper-left corner.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.planes
member.summary: Specifies the number of planes for the target device. This value must be set to 1.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.bitCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of bits-per-pixel.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.compression
member.summary: Specifies the type of compression for a compressed bottom-up bitmap (top-down DIBs cannot be compressed).

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.sizeImage
member.summary: Specifies the size, in bytes, of the image.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.xPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the bitmap.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.yPelsPerMeter
member.summary: Specifies the vertical resolution, in pixels-per-meter, of the target device for the bitmap.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.colorsUsed
member.summary: Specifies the number of color indexes in the color table that are actually used by the bitmap.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.BITMAPINFOHEADER.colorsImportant
member.summary: Specifies the number of color indexes that are required for displaying the bitmap.

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS
member.summary: Structure, which contains information about a stream and how it is compressed and saved.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.type
member.summary: Four-character code indicating the stream type.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.handler
member.summary: Four-character code for the compressor handler that will compress this video stream when it is saved.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.keyFrameEvery
member.summary: Maximum period between video key frames.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.quality
member.summary: Quality value passed to a video compressor.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.bytesPerSecond

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.flags
member.summary: Flags used for compression.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.format
member.summary: Pointer to a structure defining the data format.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.formatSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data referenced by format.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.parameters
member.summary: Video-compressor-specific data; used internally.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.parametersSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of the data referenced by parameters.

member.name: F:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.AVICOMPRESSOPTIONS.interleaveEvery
member.summary: Interleave factor for interspersing stream data with data from the first stream.

member.name: T:AForge.Video.VFW.Win32.OpenFileMode
member.summary: File access modes.
